solution_line_template: If Evan had {books_two_years_ago} books two years ago, he currently has {books_two_years_ago}-{fewer_books_now} = <<{books_two_years_ago}-{fewer_books_now}={current_books}>>{current_books} books.
In five years, Evan will have 60 more than {current_books}*{multiplier_five_times} = {five_times_current_books} books which is the number he has now.

This means Evan will have {five_times_current_books}+{additional_books_in_five_years} = <<{five_times_current_books}+{additional_books_in_five_years}={total_books_in_five_years}>>{total_books_in_five_years} books in five years.
